translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs🔽The Chapter with Kuṇḍalakesī
The Elder Nun Sakulā’s Verses
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
who had gone to the end of all things,🔽a leader who arose

original: Ito satasahassamhi,🔽kappe uppajji nāyako.🔽Hitāya sabbasattānaṁ,🔽sukhāya vadataṁ varo;
analyzed: i taḥ sata sahassamhi  kappe uppajji nāyakaḥ  hitāya sabba sattāna  sukhāya vadatam varo
translated: a hundred thousand eons ago,🔽for the benefit of all beings,🔽the best of speakers,
for the welfare of the people,

analyzed: paṭipanno sa devake  yasagga pattaḥ sirimā
translated: was practicing in the world with its gods.🔽The Victor, who had attained glory,
who had the color of gold,
worshipped by all the world,
was well-known in all directions.🔽He had overcome doubt,
and had gone beyond uncertainty,
his intentions fulfilled,
he had attained supreme Awakening.🔽The most excellent of men
was the one who gave rise to the path that had not arisen before,
he explained what had not been explained,
and he gave birth to what had not been born.
He was the one who knew the path, the one who had the path,
the one who explained the path, the most excellent of men,
the teacher who was skilled in the path,
the most excellent of charioteers.

analyzed: mahā kāruṇikaḥ satthā  dhammam desesi nāyako  nimugge kāma paṅkamhi
translated: The teacher who had great compassion,🔽the leader, taught the Dhamma:🔽He pulled out those beings
who were sunk in the mud of sensual desire.
At that time I was in Haṁsavati,
was born the delight of the Khattiyas;
Beautiful, wealthy,
beloved, and glorious.🔽The daughter of the great forest-dwelling sage,
Anandavardhana, was supremely beautiful;
Her sister was named Vemata,
and she was also named Padumuttarā.
Together with the royal maidens,
all adorned with ornaments,
approaching the Great Hero,
I listened to the teaching of Dhamma.
Then the One Honoured in the World,
the nun with the divine eye,
in the midst of the assembly,
placed her in the foremost position.
Having heard that, I was delighted,
and having given a gift to the Teacher,
and having worshipped the Fully Enlightened One,
I requested the divine eye.
Then the Teacher said to me,
‘Nanda, you will receive what you have requested;
This is the well-considered fruit
of giving the gift of the Dhamma.
After a hundred thousand aeons,
born in the family of the Okākas,
with the name Gotama in the clan,
a Teacher will appear in the world.
His heirs in the Dhamma,
with the Dhamma as their essence,
will be named Sakulā,
a disciple of the Teacher.’
By that good deed well done,
by my intention and aspiration,
Abandoning the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
In this auspicious aeon,
a kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,🔽Kassapa by name, the best of speakers,
appeared.
I was a female wanderer then,
living alone,
wandering for alms,
I obtained just a measure of oil.
Lighting a lamp with that,🔽I served the whole of the Realised One,
the shrine of the Foremost of Men,
with a serene mind.
By that good deed well done,
by my intention and aspiration,
Abandoning the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
Wherever I am reborn,
by the power of that deed,
Great lamps blaze forth,
wherever I go.
Through walls, through mountains,
I can see whatever I wish,
by the fruit of giving a lamp.
I have purified vision,
I blaze with fame,
I have faith and wisdom,
is the fruit of the gift of a lamp.
And in my last existence now,
I was born into a poor family;
I had much wealth and grain,
I was happy, honoured by the King.
I was endowed with all the limbs,
adorned with all the ornaments;
I stood at the window
as the Gracious One entered the city.
Seeing him shining with glory,
honoured by gods and men;
Endowed with the (thirty-two) excellent characteristics,
adorned with (eighty minor) characteristics;
With a mind uplifted and joyful,
I delighted in the going forth.
Not long after that,
I attained Liberation.
I became powerful in the (psychic) abilities,
and in the divine ear element;
I knew the minds of others,
I did the work of the Teacher.
I knew (my) past lives,
and the divine eye was purified;
Having expelled all the pollutants,
I was purified, stainless.
The Teacher was attended to by me,
and the Teaching of the Buddha was done;
The heavy burden was put down,
the attachment to becoming was destroyed.
That for which I went forth
from the home to the homeless life,
That purpose has been achieved by me,🔽and I am free of all defilements.
the destruction of all the fetters.

original: Tato mahākāruṇiko,🔽etadagge ṭhapesi maṁ;🔽Dibbacakkhukānaṁ aggā,🔽sakulāti naruttamo.
analyzed: tatas mahā kāruṇikaḥ  etat agge ṭhapesi ma  dibba cakkhukānam aggā  naruttamaḥ
translated: Then the Greatly Compassionate One,🔽the Supreme One, placed me in the foremost position among those with the divine eye.
My defilements were burned up,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ sakulā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam sakulā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus spoke the nun Sakulā, and the Teacher said: “Well done!” and approved of it.
The nun Sakulā’s verses are finished.🔽The Chapter of the Elder Nuns is finished.
